text: @babybesmart @EnvAgency Most peaks now are lower than first peaks - for your location please follow flood warnings advice for your postcode - hope you stay safe JC https://t.co/K5GUW3z87V
@EnvAgency @HertsFRSControl air intakes are too low in modern cars
@wiltscouncil @EnvAgencySW What‚Äôs the obtrusive structure that it says is going to be removed?
@johncurtinEA @EnvAgency Does this mean we continue to be at threat until the peak date?

@EnvAgencyAnglia It‚Äôs a pity you don‚Äôt spend money on dredging the 100ft river out from Stowbridge to King‚Äôs Lynn. Hasn‚Äôt been done for years! You wouldn‚Äôt then have to bring in extra pumps!!!

@johncurtinEA @EnvAgency Always time of travel is the important analysis for a big catchment, especially as the smaller rivers empty. Great analysis that will help the strategic managers do their thing !

We have plans to transform #Salisbury and create a lasting legacy for future generations. 

We know that sounds big, that‚Äôs because it is.

text: Due to water off @ShrewsSchool #hodgson Hall, there has been lots of damage to the footpath leading down to #becksfield #shrewsbury - @shropcouncil @shrewsburytc @EnvAgency

@RussellB1ggs @Hillfortian @WestNorfolkBC @EnvAgencyAnglia @N_Rivers_Trust @AnglianWater @The_WMA @WildTroutTrust @jamesowild I had a similar experience once, when we did a fish survey of the River Hamble from the wooded, silty shore at Manor Farm - we hauled in an old car tyre in our net, inside it was full of eels, like a mini eel-shaped reef

Water levels remain high in the county, particularly on the River Ouse. We have spoken to people in high risk areas and we will continue to patrol throughout the night. @RussellB1ggs @Hillfortian @WestNorfolkBC @EnvAgencyAnglia @N_Rivers_Trust @AnglianWater @The_WMA @WildTroutTrust @jamesowild Lovely river tales - we need such personal memories to avoid shifting baselines in our current efforts to reverse the decline of our #chalkstreams - will we ever experience such a healthy eel population again in the UK?  1/2
